Hi all,

I've been a long time lurker and very, very rarely poster ... I've=
 
enjoyed the knowledgeable discussions and even the not so 
knowledgeable =
discussions as well, lol.

Anyway, before I start explaining what this post=
 is about, keep in 
mind that I'm at university majoring in Asian Studies a=
nd 
Philosophy, with my major interest being anything to do with East 
Asia=
, and especially Japan.  I'm quite widely read on Japanese 
culture, histor=
y and language.  

My university's anime society is holding its second conv=
ention in a 
couple of weeks and I'm presenting two lectures/discussions in=
 a 
more serious, educational and factual nature then what is usually 
pres=
ented at such events.  One is titled "Shinto, its origins and 
what it mean=
s to modern Japan" (being of major importance to my 
potential post-graduat=
e studies/research) and the other is 
titled "Samurai, Ninja and Mythconcep=
tions".  Now the purpose of 
this post is to ask the samurai history commun=
ity about any good 
resources/links related to the second topic, well anyth=
ing relating 
to the first is quite welcome too.  I've come across quite a =
lot of 
info already, the uni library has a very large collection of books =

about Japan, in fact too much, because I can't possibly look at it 
all be=
fore the con =85 I'm also doing a summer school unit which takes 
priority.=
 

If it's ok with Nate, I would like to quote extensively from 
his "Commo=
n Misconceptions Concerning those Kewl Ninja" as well 
as "The Top Eleven W=
estern, Modern Day Common Misconceptions About 
The Samurai", is that yours=
 as well Nate?  Also do you have any 
references for these articles?  

Che=
ers,
Warren
